New Records: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched five brilliant innings with one walk and two strikeouts, throwing 63 pitches -- 39 of them strikes.

Enrique Hernandez crushed a solo shot to left field to put the Dodgers up 1-0 in the second inning, pouncing on a first-pitch fastball from Darvish, who had walked Max Muncy to open the inning before Will Smith hit into a double play.
Teoscar Hernandez made it 2-0 in the seventh, launching a 420 foot blast into the left field seats.
It was the 14th post-season homer for the 33-year-old Enrique Hernandez.
Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto induced Fernando Tatis to hit into an inning-ending double play and retired the last seven batters he faced before he turned it over to the Dodgers relievers -- who closed it out without allowing a hit over four innings.
Darvish retired 14 straight batters before Teoscar Hernandez made it 2-0 in the seventh.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers, the 2020 World Series champions, are back in the league championship series for the first time since 2021.
The victory means Japanese superstar Shohei Ohtani will have a chance to battle for a World Series berth.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers completed a 3-2 victory over the Padres in the best-of-five National League division series and will host the New York Mets in game one of the best-of-seven NLCS on Sunday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers will host the New York Mets in game one of the best-of-seven NLCS on Sunday.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto came out on top in a historic duel with San Diego hurler Yu Darvish -- the first Major League Baseball post-season match-up between two Japanese-born starting pitchers.
Others: The Dodgers relievers closed it out without allowing a hit over four innings.
Darvish pitched several strong innings, but he gave up solo home runs to Enrique Hernandez and Teoscar Hernandez, and that was all the Dodgers needed.
